intro: Distasis parryi, commonly known as Parry's distaff, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Distasis parryi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
